Experiences that Inspire and Broaden HorizonsAfter completing the online phase of the Innovation Program, I traveled to Israel and Dubai in August/2023. Here are the most impactful moments.ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡± Israel: A Sequence of Wow Moments ğŸ”¹ Technology & PurposeWe visited companies that showed how technology can truly drive transformation â€” two stood out for their creativity and impact:â¡ Facetrom : using facial biometrics to help unbanked individuals access credit by predicting default risk.â¡ Watergen Ltd: creating clean drinking water from air humidityâœ¨ Can you imagine how many social and economic barriers can be overcome when people gain access to basic resources like credit and clean water?ğŸ”¹ Education, Science & Sustainabilityâ¡Weizmann Institute of Science: a global leader in cutting-edge research on cancer, AI, and biomedicine.â¡Kibbutz Hatzerim and Netafim: desert agriculture reinvented through scalable, sustainable solutions â€” including raising fish in the desert, using brackish water, to grow jojoba and other crops.â¡ Peres Center for Peace and Innovation: a powerful intersection of education, technology, and social impact â€” including an immersive 3D experience of the future.ğŸ”¹ People at the Center of EverythingOne of the most powerful moments was a talk by Golan Vach, who said: â¡ â€œWhat makes the difference is the extra mile.â€ â¡ â€œPeople are always the difference.â€ These words captured a key insight from this journey: innovation only becomes real when driven by passionate, purpose-driven people.ğŸ”¹ Culture That InspiresExperiencing the Shabbat, walking the Via Dolorosa, visiting the Church of the Holy Sepulchre, feeling the energy of the Western Wall, sleeping in the desert, being welcomed into a Bedouin tent, and visiting Yad Vashem â€” I came to understand that the strength of a culture lies in its people.ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡ª Dubai: Where Tradition Meets Bold Vision ğŸ”¹ Living Culture on Every CornerBy walking the streets, listening to locals, and exploring markets and mosques, I gained a meaningful glimpse into a rich and inspiring culture.ğŸ”¹ A Window into the FutureThe Museum of the Future in Dubai was a standout moment â€” a bold vision of the world in 2071.â€‹What struck me most was how Dubai and Israel, though different in approach, are aligned on global key challengers â€” such as shifting to plant-based food and improving waste management.Both the Museum of the Future and the Peres Center for Peace and Innovation inspire us to shape a better world by combining vision with real solutions. Different approaches, yet deeply complementary â€” a clear sign that some challenges can only be solved through global collaboration.-----This incredible journey was just the beginning. In 2024, I started an MBA in AI & Big Data at USP to deepen my purpose-driven path. More reflections coming soon!ğŸš€hashtag#innovation hashtag#transformation hashtag#future hashtag#career hashtag#purpose hashtag#technology hashtag#realexperiences hashtag#sabbaticalyear hashtag#learning hashtag#lifeinmotion hashtag#AI hashtag#BigData

Experiences that Inspire and Broaden HorizonsAfter completing the online phase of the Innovation Program, I traveled to Israel and Dubai in August/2023. Here are the most impactful moments.ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡± Israel: A Sequence of Wow Moments ğŸ”¹ Technology & PurposeWe visited companies that showed how technology can truly drive transformation â€” two stood out for their creativity and impact:â¡ Facetrom : using facial biometrics to help unbanked individuals access credit by predicting default risk.â¡ Watergen Ltd: creating clean drinking water from air humidityâœ¨ Can you imagine how many social and economic barriers can be overcome when people gain access to basic resources like credit and clean water?ğŸ”¹ Education, Science & Sustainabilityâ¡Weizmann Institute of Science: a global leader in cutting-edge research on cancer, AI, and biomedicine.â¡Kibbutz Hatzerim and Netafim: desert agriculture reinvented through scalable, sustainable solutions â€” including raising fish in the desert, using brackish water, to grow jojoba and other crops.â¡ Peres Center for Peace and Innovation: a powerful intersection of education, technology, and social impact â€” including an immersive 3D experience of the future.ğŸ”¹ People at the Center of EverythingOne of the most powerful moments was a talk by Golan Vach, who said: â¡ â€œWhat makes the difference is the extra mile.â€ â¡ â€œPeople are always the difference.â€ These words captured a key insight from this journey: innovation only becomes real when driven by passionate, purpose-driven people.ğŸ”¹ Culture That InspiresExperiencing the Shabbat, walking the Via Dolorosa, visiting the Church of the Holy Sepulchre, feeling the energy of the Western Wall, sleeping in the desert, being welcomed into a Bedouin tent, and visiting Yad Vashem â€” I came to understand that the strength of a culture lies in its people.ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡ª Dubai: Where Tradition Meets Bold Vision ğŸ”¹ Living Culture on Every CornerBy walking the streets, listening to locals, and exploring markets and mosques, I gained a meaningful glimpse into a rich and inspiring culture.ğŸ”¹ A Window into the FutureThe Museum of the Future in Dubai was a standout moment â€” a bold vision of the world in 2071.â€‹What struck me most was how Dubai and Israel, though different in approach, are aligned on global key challengers â€” such as shifting to plant-based food and improving waste management.Both the Museum of the Future and the Peres Center for Peace and Innovation inspire us to shape a better world by combining vision with real solutions. Different approaches, yet deeply complementary â€” a clear sign that some challenges can only be solved through global collaboration.-----This incredible journey was just the beginning. In 2024, I started an MBA in AI & Big Data at USP to deepen my purpose-driven path. Here are the most impactful moments.ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡± Israel: A Sequence of Wow Moments ğŸ”¹ Technology & PurposeWe visited companies that showed how technology can truly drive transformation â€” two stood out for their creativity and impact:â¡ Facetrom : using facial biometrics to help unbanked individuals access credit by predicting default risk.â¡ Watergen Ltd: creating clean drinking water from air humidityâœ¨ Can you imagine how many social and economic barriers can be overcome when people gain access to basic resources like credit and clean water?ğŸ”¹ Education, Science & Sustainabilityâ¡Weizmann Institute of Science: a global leader in cutting-edge research on cancer, AI, and biomedicine.â¡Kibbutz Hatzerim and Netafim: desert agriculture reinvented through scalable, sustainable solutions â€” including raising fish in the desert, using brackish water, to grow jojoba and other crops.â¡ Peres Center for Peace and Innovation: a powerful intersection of education, technology, and social impact â€” including an immersive 3D experience of the future.ğŸ”¹ People at the Center of EverythingOne of the most powerful moments was a talk by Golan Vach, who said: â¡ passionate, purpose-driven people.ğŸ”¹ Culture That InspiresExperiencing the Shabbat, walking the Via Dolorosa, visiting the Church of the Holy Sepulchre, feeling the energy of the Western Wall, aligned on global key challengers â€” such as shifting to plant-based food and improving waste management.Both the Museum of the Future and the Peres Center for Peace and Innovation inspire us to shape a better world by combining vision with real solutions. Different approaches, yet deeply complementary â€” a clear sign that some challenges can only be solved through global collaboration.-----This incredible journey was just the beginning. Experiences that Inspire and Broaden HorizonsAfter completing the online phase of the Innovation Program, I traveled to Israel and Dubai in August/2023. Here are the most impactful moments.ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡± Israel: A Sequence of Wow Moments ğŸ”¹ Technology & PurposeWe visited companies that showed how technology can truly drive transformation â€” two stood out for their creativity and impact:â¡ Facetrom : using facial biometrics to help unbanked individuals access credit by predicting default risk.â¡ Watergen Ltd: creating clean drinking water from air humidityâœ¨ Can you imagine how many social and economic barriers can be overcome when people gain access to basic resources like credit and clean water?ğŸ”¹ Education, Science & Sustainabilityâ¡Weizmann Institute of Science: a global leader in cutting-edge research on cancer, AI, and biomedicine.â¡Kibbutz Hatzerim and Netafim: desert agriculture reinvented through scalable, sustainable solutions â€” including raising fish in the desert, using brackish water, to grow jojoba and other crops.â¡ Peres Center for Peace and Innovation: a powerful intersection of education, technology, and social impact â€” including an immersive 3D experience of the future.ğŸ”¹ People at the Center of EverythingOne of the most powerful moments was a talk by Golan Vach, who said: â¡ â€œWhat makes the difference is the extra mile.â€ â¡ â€œPeople are always the difference.â€ These words captured a key insight from this journey: innovation only becomes real when driven by passionate, purpose-driven people.ğŸ”¹ Culture That InspiresExperiencing the Shabbat, walking the Via Dolorosa, visiting the Church of the Holy Sepulchre, feeling the energy of the Western Wall, sleeping in the desert, being welcomed into a Bedouin tent, and visiting Yad Vashem â€” I came to understand that the strength of a culture lies in its people.ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡ª Dubai: Where Tradition Meets Bold Vision ğŸ”¹ Living Culture on Every CornerBy walking the streets, listening to locals, and exploring markets and mosques, I gained a meaningful glimpse into a rich and inspiring culture.ğŸ”¹ A Window into the FutureThe Museum of the Future in Dubai was a standout moment â€” a bold vision of the world in 2071.â€‹What struck me most was how Dubai and Israel, though different in approach, are aligned on global key challengers â€” such as shifting to plant-based food and improving waste management.Both the Museum of the Future and the Peres Center for Peace and Innovation inspire us to shape a better world by combining vision with real solutions. Different approaches, yet deeply complementary â€” a clear sign that some challenges can only be solved through global collaboration.-----This incredible journey was just the beginning. In 2024, I started an MBA in AI & Big Data at USP to deepen my purpose-driven path. Here are the most impactful moments.ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡± Israel: A Sequence of Wow Moments ğŸ”¹ Technology & PurposeWe visited companies that showed how technology can truly drive transformation â€” two stood out for their creativity and impact:â¡ Facetrom : using facial biometrics to help unbanked individuals access credit by predicting default risk.â¡ Watergen Ltd: creating clean drinking water from air humidityâœ¨ Can you imagine how many social and economic barriers can be overcome when people gain access to basic resources like credit and clean water?ğŸ”¹ Education, Science & Sustainabilityâ¡Weizmann Institute of Science: a global leader in cutting-edge research on cancer, AI, and biomedicine.â¡Kibbutz Hatzerim and Netafim: desert agriculture reinvented through scalable, sustainable solutions â€” including raising fish in the desert, using brackish water, to grow jojoba and other crops.â¡ Peres Center for Peace and Innovation: a powerful intersection of education, technology, and social impact â€” including an immersive 3D experience of the future.ğŸ”¹ People at the Center of EverythingOne of the most powerful moments was a talk by Golan Vach, who said: â¡ passionate, purpose-driven people.ğŸ”¹ Culture That InspiresExperiencing the Shabbat, walking the Via Dolorosa, visiting the Church of the Holy Sepulchre, feeling the energy of the Western Wall, aligned on global key challengers â€” such as shifting to plant-based food and improving waste management.Both the Museum of the Future and the Peres Center for Peace and Innovation inspire us to shape a better world by combining vision with real solutions. Different approaches, yet deeply complementary â€” a clear sign that some challenges can only be solved through global collaboration.-----This incredible journey was just the beginning. Experiences that Inspire and Broaden HorizonsAfter completing the online phase of the Innovation Program, I traveled to Israel and Dubai in August/2023. Here are the most impactful moments.ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡± Israel: A Sequence of Wow Moments ğŸ”¹ Technology & PurposeWe visited companies that showed how technology can truly drive transformation â€” two stood out for their creativity and impact:â¡ Facetrom : using facial biometrics to help unbanked individuals access credit by predicting default risk.â¡ Watergen Ltd: creating clean drinking water from air humidityâœ¨ Can you imagine how many social and economic barriers can be overcome when people gain access to basic resources like credit and clean water?ğŸ”¹ Education, Science & Sustainabilityâ¡Weizmann Institute of Science: a global leader in cutting-edge research on cancer, AI, and biomedicine.â¡Kibbutz Hatzerim and Netafim: desert agriculture reinvented through scalable, sustainable solutions â€” including raising fish in the desert, using brackish water, to grow jojoba and other crops.â¡ Peres Center for Peace and Innovation: a powerful intersection of education, technology, and social impact â€” including an immersive 3D experience of the future.ğŸ”¹ People at the Center of EverythingOne of the most powerful moments was a talk by Golan Vach, who said: â¡ â€œWhat makes the difference is the extra mile.â€ â¡ â€œPeople are always the difference.â€ These words captured a key insight from this journey: innovation only becomes real when driven by passionate, purpose-driven people.ğŸ”¹ Culture That InspiresExperiencing the Shabbat, walking the Via Dolorosa, visiting the Church of the Holy Sepulchre, feeling the energy of the Western Wall, sleeping in the desert, being welcomed into a Bedouin tent, and visiting Yad Vashem â€” I came to understand that the strength of a culture lies in its people.ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡ª Dubai: Where Tradition Meets Bold Vision ğŸ”¹ Living Culture on Every CornerBy walking the streets, listening to locals, and exploring markets and mosques, I gained a meaningful glimpse into a rich and inspiring culture.ğŸ”¹ A Window into the FutureThe Museum of the Future in Dubai was a standout moment â€” a bold vision of the world in 2071.â€‹What struck me most was how Dubai and Israel, though different in approach, are aligned on global key challengers â€” such as shifting to plant-based food and improving waste management.Both the Museum of the Future and the Peres Center for Peace and Innovation inspire us to shape a better world by combining vision with real solutions. Different approaches, yet deeply complementary â€” a clear sign that some challenges can only be solved through global collaboration.-----This incredible journey was just the beginning. In 2024, I started an MBA in AI & Big Data at USP to deepen my purpose-driven path. Here are the most impactful moments.ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡± Israel: A Sequence of Wow Moments ğŸ”¹ Technology & PurposeWe visited companies that showed how technology can truly drive transformation â€” two stood out for their creativity and impact:â¡ Facetrom : using facial biometrics to help unbanked individuals access credit by predicting default risk.â¡ Watergen Ltd: creating clean drinking water from air humidityâœ¨ Can you imagine how many social and economic barriers can be overcome when people gain access to basic resources like credit and clean water?ğŸ”¹ Education, Science & Sustainabilityâ¡Weizmann Institute of Science: a global leader in cutting-edge research on cancer, AI, and biomedicine.â¡Kibbutz Hatzerim and Netafim: desert agriculture reinvented through scalable, sustainable solutions â€” including raising fish in the desert, using brackish water, to grow jojoba and other crops.â¡ Peres Center for Peace and Innovation: a powerful intersection of education, technology, and social impact â€” including an immersive 3D experience of the future.ğŸ”¹ People at the Center of EverythingOne of the most powerful moments was a talk by Golan Vach, who said: â¡ passionate, purpose-driven people.ğŸ”¹ Culture That InspiresExperiencing the Shabbat, walking the Via Dolorosa, visiting the Church of the Holy Sepulchre, feeling the energy of the Western Wall, aligned on global key challengers â€” such as shifting to plant-based food and improving waste management.Both the Museum of the Future and the Peres Center for Peace and Innovation inspire us to shape a better world by combining vision with real solutions. Different approaches, yet deeply complementary â€” a clear sign that some challenges can only be solved through global collaboration.-----This incredible journey was just the beginning. Experiences that Inspire and Broaden HorizonsAfter completing the online phase of the Innovation Program, I traveled to Israel and Dubai in August/2023. Here are the most impactful moments.ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡± Israel: A Sequence of Wow Moments ğŸ”¹ Technology & PurposeWe visited companies that showed how technology can truly drive transformation â€” two stood out for their creativity and impact:â¡ Facetrom : using facial biometrics to help unbanked individuals access credit by predicting default risk.â¡ Watergen Ltd: creating clean drinking water from air humidityâœ¨ Can you imagine how many social and economic barriers can be overcome when people gain access to basic resources like credit and clean water?ğŸ”¹ Education, Science & Sustainabilityâ¡Weizmann Institute of Science: a global leader in cutting-edge research on cancer, AI, and biomedicine.â¡Kibbutz Hatzerim and Netafim: desert agriculture reinvented through scalable, sustainable solutions â€” including raising fish in the desert, using brackish water, to grow jojoba and other crops.â¡ Peres Center for Peace and Innovation: a powerful intersection of education, technology, and social impact â€” including an immersive 3D experience of the future.ğŸ”¹ People at the Center of EverythingOne of the most powerful moments was a talk by Golan Vach, who said: â¡ â€œWhat makes the difference is the extra mile.â€ â¡ â€œPeople are always the difference.â€ These words captured a key insight from this journey: innovation only becomes real when driven by passionate, purpose-driven people.ğŸ”¹ Culture That InspiresExperiencing the Shabbat, walking the Via Dolorosa, visiting the Church of the Holy Sepulchre, feeling the energy of the Western Wall, sleeping in the desert, being welcomed into a Bedouin tent, and visiting Yad Vashem â€” I came to understand that the strength of a culture lies in its people.ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡ª Dubai: Where Tradition Meets Bold Vision ğŸ”¹ Living Culture on Every CornerBy walking the streets, listening to locals, and exploring markets and mosques, I gained a meaningful glimpse into a rich and inspiring culture.ğŸ”¹ A Window into the FutureThe Museum of the Future in Dubai was a standout moment â€” a bold vision of the world in 2071.â€‹What struck me most was how Dubai and Israel, though different in approach, are aligned on global key challengers â€” such as shifting to plant-based food and improving waste management.Both the Museum of the Future and the Peres Center for Peace and Innovation inspire us to shape a better world by combining vision with real solutions. Different approaches, yet deeply complementary â€” a clear sign that some challenges can only be solved through global collaboration.-----This incredible journey was just the beginning. In 2024, I started an MBA in AI & Big Data at USP to deepen my purpose-driven path. Here are the most impactful moments.ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡± Israel: A Sequence of Wow Moments ğŸ”¹ Technology & PurposeWe visited companies that showed how technology can truly drive transformation â€” two stood out for their creativity and impact:â¡ Facetrom : using facial biometrics to help unbanked individuals access credit by predicting default risk.â¡ Watergen Ltd: creating clean drinking water from air humidityâœ¨ Can you imagine how many social and economic barriers can be overcome when people gain access to basic resources like credit and clean water?ğŸ”¹ Education, Science & Sustainabilityâ¡Weizmann Institute of Science: a global leader in cutting-edge research on cancer, AI, and biomedicine.â¡Kibbutz Hatzerim and Netafim: desert agriculture reinvented through scalable, sustainable solutions â€” including raising fish in the desert, using brackish water, to grow jojoba and other crops.â¡ Peres Center for Peace and Innovation: a powerful intersection of education, technology, and social impact â€” including an immersive 3D experience of the future.ğŸ”¹ People at the Center of EverythingOne of the most powerful moments was a talk by Golan Vach, who said: â¡ passionate, purpose-driven people.ğŸ”¹ Culture That InspiresExperiencing the Shabbat, walking the Via Dolorosa, visiting the Church of the Holy Sepulchre, feeling the energy of the Western Wall, aligned on global key challengers â€” such as shifting to plant-based food and improving waste management.Both the Museum of the Future and the Peres Center for Peace and Innovation inspire us to shape a better world by combining vision with real solutions. Different approaches, yet deeply complementary â€” a clear sign that some challenges can only be solved through global collaboration.-----This incredible journey was just the beginning. Experiences that Inspire and Broaden HorizonsAfter completing the online phase of the Innovation Program, I traveled to Israel and Dubai in August/2023. Here are the most impactful moments.ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡± Israel: A Sequence of Wow Moments ğŸ”¹ Technology & PurposeWe visited companies that showed how technology can truly drive transformation â€” two stood out for their creativity and impact:â¡ Facetrom : using facial biometrics to help unbanked individuals access credit by predicting default risk.â¡ Watergen Ltd: creating clean drinking water from air humidityâœ¨ Can you imagine how many social and economic barriers can be overcome when people gain access to basic resources like credit and clean water?ğŸ”¹ Education, Science & Sustainabilityâ¡Weizmann Institute of Science: a global leader in cutting-edge research on cancer, AI, and biomedicine.â¡Kibbutz Hatzerim and Netafim: desert agriculture reinvented through scalable, sustainable solutions â€” including raising fish in the desert, using brackish water, to grow jojoba and other crops.â¡ Peres Center for Peace and Innovation: a powerful intersection of education, technology, and social impact â€” including an immersive 3D experience of the future.ğŸ”¹ People at the Center of EverythingOne of the most powerful moments was a talk by Golan Vach, who said: â¡ â€œWhat makes the difference is the extra mile.â€ â¡ â€œPeople are always the difference.â€ These words captured a key insight from this journey: innovation only becomes real when driven by passionate, purpose-driven people.ğŸ”¹ Culture That InspiresExperiencing the Shabbat, walking the Via Dolorosa, visiting the Church of the Holy Sepulchre, feeling the energy of the Western Wall, sleeping in the desert, being welcomed into a Bedouin tent, and visiting Yad Vashem â€” I came to understand that the strength of a culture lies in its people.ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡ª Dubai: Where Tradition Meets Bold Vision ğŸ”¹ Living Culture on Every CornerBy walking the streets, listening to locals, and exploring markets and mosques, I gained a meaningful glimpse into a rich and inspiring culture.ğŸ”¹ A Window into the FutureThe Museum of the Future in Dubai was a standout moment â€” a bold vision of the world in 2071.â€‹What struck me most was how Dubai and Israel, though different in approach, are aligned on global key challengers â€” such as shifting to plant-based food and improving waste management.Both the Museum of the Future and the Peres Center for Peace and Innovation inspire us to shape a better world by combining vision with real solutions. Different approaches, yet deeply complementary â€” a clear sign that some challenges can only be solved through global collaboration.-----This incredible journey was just the beginning. In 2024, I started an MBA in AI & Big Data at USP to deepen my purpose-driven path. Here are the most impactful moments.ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡± Israel: A Sequence of Wow Moments ğŸ”¹ Technology & PurposeWe visited companies that showed how technology can truly drive transformation â€” two stood out for their creativity and impact:â¡ Facetrom : using facial biometrics to help unbanked individuals access credit by predicting default risk.â¡ Watergen Ltd: creating clean drinking water from air humidityâœ¨ Can you imagine how many social and economic barriers can be overcome when people gain access to basic resources like credit and clean water?ğŸ”¹ Education, Science & Sustainabilityâ¡Weizmann Institute of Science: a global leader in cutting-edge research on cancer, AI, and biomedicine.â¡Kibbutz Hatzerim and Netafim: desert agriculture reinvented through scalable, sustainable solutions â€” including raising fish in the desert, using brackish water, to grow jojoba and other crops.â¡ Peres Center for Peace and Innovation: a powerful intersection of education, technology, and social impact â€” including an immersive 3D experience of the future.ğŸ”¹ People at the Center of EverythingOne of the most powerful moments was a talk by Golan Vach, who said: â¡ passionate, purpose-driven people.ğŸ”¹ Culture That InspiresExperiencing the Shabbat, walking the Via Dolorosa, visiting the Church of the Holy Sepulchre, feeling the energy of the Western Wall, aligned on global key challengers â€” such as shifting to plant-based food and improving waste management.Both the Museum of the Future and the Peres Center for Peace and Innovation inspire us to shape a better world by combining vision with real solutions. Different approaches, yet deeply complementary â€” a clear sign that some challenges can only be solved through global collaboration.-----This incredible journey was just the beginning. Experiences that Inspire and Broaden HorizonsAfter completing the online phase of the Innovation Program, I traveled to Israel and Dubai in August/2023. Here are the most impactful moments.ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡± Israel: A Sequence of Wow Moments ğŸ”¹ Technology & PurposeWe visited companies that showed how technology can truly drive transformation â€” two stood out for their creativity and impact:â¡ Facetrom : using facial biometrics to help unbanked individuals access credit by predicting default risk.â¡ Watergen Ltd: creating clean drinking water from air humidityâœ¨ Can you imagine how many social and economic barriers can be overcome when people gain access to basic resources like credit and clean water?ğŸ”¹ Education, Science & Sustainabilityâ¡Weizmann Institute of Science: a global leader in cutting-edge research on cancer, AI, and biomedicine.â¡Kibbutz Hatzerim and Netafim: desert agriculture reinvented through scalable, sustainable solutions â€” including raising fish in the desert, using brackish water, to grow jojoba and other crops.â¡ Peres Center for Peace and Innovation: a powerful intersection of education, technology, and social impact â€” including an immersive 3D experience of the future.ğŸ”¹ People at the Center of EverythingOne of the most powerful moments was a talk by Golan Vach, who said: â¡ â€œWhat makes the difference is the extra mile.â€ â¡ â€œPeople are always the difference.â€ These words captured a key insight from this journey: innovation only becomes real when driven by passionate, purpose-driven people.ğŸ”¹ Culture That InspiresExperiencing the Shabbat, walking the Via Dolorosa, visiting the Church of the Holy Sepulchre, feeling the energy of the Western Wall, sleeping in the desert, being welcomed into a Bedouin tent, and visiting Yad Vashem â€” I came to understand that the strength of a culture lies in its people.ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡ª Dubai: Where Tradition Meets Bold Vision ğŸ”¹ Living Culture on Every CornerBy walking the streets, listening to locals, and exploring markets and mosques, I gained a meaningful glimpse into a rich and inspiring culture.ğŸ”¹ A Window into the FutureThe Museum of the Future in Dubai was a standout moment â€” a bold vision of the world in 2071.â€‹What struck me most was how Dubai and Israel, though different in approach, are aligned on global key challengers â€” such as shifting to plant-based food and improving waste management.Both the Museum of the Future and the Peres Center for Peace and Innovation inspire us to shape a better world by combining vision with real solutions. Different approaches, yet deeply complementary â€” a clear sign that some challenges can only be solved through global collaboration.-----This incredible journey was just the beginning. In 2024, I started an MBA in AI & Big Data at USP to deepen my purpose-driven path. Here are the most impactful moments.ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡± Israel: A Sequence of Wow Moments ğŸ”¹ Technology & PurposeWe visited companies that showed how technology can truly drive transformation â€” two stood out for their creativity and impact:â¡ Facetrom : using facial biometrics to help unbanked individuals access credit by predicting default risk.â¡ Watergen Ltd: creating clean drinking water from air humidityâœ¨ Can you imagine how many social and economic barriers can be overcome when people gain access to basic resources like credit and clean water?ğŸ”¹ Education, Science & Sustainabilityâ¡Weizmann Institute of Science: a global leader in cutting-edge research on cancer, AI, and biomedicine.â¡Kibbutz Hatzerim and Netafim: desert agriculture reinvented through scalable, sustainable solutions â€” including raising fish in the desert, using brackish water, to grow jojoba and other crops.â¡ Peres Center for Peace and Innovation: a powerful intersection of education, technology, and social impact â€” including an immersive 3D experience of the future.ğŸ”¹ People at the Center of EverythingOne of the most powerful moments was a talk by Golan Vach, who said: â¡ passionate, purpose-driven people.ğŸ”¹ Culture That InspiresExperiencing the Shabbat, walking the Via Dolorosa, visiting the Church of the Holy Sepulchre, feeling the energy of the Western Wall, aligned on global key challengers â€” such as shifting to plant-based food and improving waste management.Both the Museum of the Future and the Peres Center for Peace and Innovation inspire us to shape a better world by combining vision with real solutions. Different approaches, yet deeply complementary â€” a clear sign that some challenges can only be solved through global collaboration.-----This incredible journey was just the beginning. Experiences that Inspire and Broaden HorizonsAfter completing the online phase of the Innovation Program, I traveled to Israel and Dubai in August/2023. Here are the most impactful moments.ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡± Israel: A Sequence of Wow Moments ğŸ”¹ Technology & PurposeWe visited companies that showed how technology can truly drive transformation â€” two stood out for their creativity and impact:â¡ Facetrom : using facial biometrics to help unbanked individuals access credit by predicting default risk.â¡ Watergen Ltd: creating clean drinking water from air humidityâœ¨ Can you imagine how many social and economic barriers can be overcome when people gain access to basic resources like credit and clean water?ğŸ”¹ Education, Science & Sustainabilityâ¡Weizmann Institute of Science: a global leader in cutting-edge research on cancer, AI, and biomedicine.â¡Kibbutz Hatzerim and Netafim: desert agriculture reinvented through scalable, sustainable solutions â€” including raising fish in the desert, using brackish water, to grow jojoba and other crops.â¡ Peres Center for Peace and Innovation: a powerful intersection of education, technology, and social impact â€” including an immersive 3D experience of the future.ğŸ”¹ People at the Center of EverythingOne of the most powerful moments was a talk by Golan Vach, who said: â¡ â€œWhat makes the difference is the extra mile.â€ â¡ â€œPeople are always the difference.â€ These words captured a key insight from this journey: innovation only becomes real when driven by passionate, purpose-driven people.ğŸ”¹ Culture That InspiresExperiencing the Shabbat, walking the Via Dolorosa, visiting the Church of the Holy Sepulchre, feeling the energy of the Western Wall, sleeping in the desert, being welcomed into a Bedouin tent, and visiting Yad Vashem â€” I came to understand that the strength of a culture lies in its people.ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡ª Dubai: Where Tradition Meets Bold Vision ğŸ”¹ Living Culture on Every CornerBy walking the streets, listening to locals, and exploring markets and mosques, I gained a meaningful glimpse into a rich and inspiring culture.ğŸ”¹ A Window into the FutureThe Museum of the Future in Dubai was a standout moment â€” a bold vision of the world in 2071.â€‹What struck me most was how Dubai and Israel, though different in approach, are aligned on global key challengers â€” such as shifting to plant-based food and improving waste management.Both the Museum of the Future and the Peres Center for Peace and Innovation inspire us to shape a better world by combining vision with real solutions. Different approaches, yet deeply complementary â€” a clear sign that some challenges can only be solved through global collaboration.-----This incredible journey was just the beginning. In 2024, I started an MBA in AI & Big Data at USP to deepen my purpose-driven path. Here are the most impactful moments.ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡± Israel: A Sequence of Wow Moments ğŸ”¹ Technology & PurposeWe visited companies that showed how technology can truly drive transformation â€” two stood out for their creativity and impact:â¡ Facetrom : using facial biometrics to help unbanked individuals access credit by predicting default risk.â¡ Watergen Ltd: creating clean drinking water from air humidityâœ¨ Can you imagine how many social and economic barriers can be overcome when people gain access to basic resources like credit and clean water?ğŸ”¹ Education, Science & Sustainabilityâ¡Weizmann Institute of Science: a global leader in cutting-edge research on cancer, AI, and biomedicine.â¡Kibbutz Hatzerim and Netafim: desert agriculture reinvented through scalable, sustainable solutions â€” including raising fish in the desert, using brackish water, to grow jojoba and other crops.â¡ Peres Center for Peace and Innovation: a powerful intersection of education, technology, and social impact â€” including an immersive 3D experience of the future.ğŸ”¹ People at the Center of EverythingOne of the most powerful moments was a talk by Golan Vach, who said: â¡ passionate, purpose-driven people.ğŸ”¹ Culture That InspiresExperiencing the Shabbat, walking the Via Dolorosa, visiting the Church of the Holy Sepulchre, feeling the energy of the Western Wall, aligned on global key challengers â€” such as shifting to plant-based food and improving waste management.Both the Museum of the Future and the Peres Center for Peace and Innovation inspire us to shape a better world by combining vision with real solutions. Different approaches, yet deeply complementary â€” a clear sign that some challenges can only be solved through global collaboration.-----This incredible journey was just the beginning. Experiences that Inspire and Broaden HorizonsAfter completing the online phase of the Innovation Program, I traveled to Israel and Dubai in August/2023. Here are the most impactful moments.ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡± Israel: A Sequence of Wow Moments ğŸ”¹ Technology & PurposeWe visited companies that showed how technology can truly drive transformation â€” two stood out for their creativity and impact:â¡ Facetrom : using facial biometrics to help unbanked individuals access credit by predicting default risk.â¡ Watergen Ltd: creating clean drinking water from air humidityâœ¨ Can you imagine how many social and economic barriers can be overcome when people gain access to basic resources like credit and clean water?ğŸ”¹ Education, Science & Sustainabilityâ¡Weizmann Institute of Science: a global leader in cutting-edge research on cancer, AI, and biomedicine.â¡Kibbutz Hatzerim and Netafim: desert agriculture reinvented through scalable, sustainable solutions â€” including raising fish in the desert, using brackish water, to grow jojoba and other crops.â¡ Peres Center for Peace and Innovation: a powerful intersection of education, technology, and social impact â€” including an immersive 3D experience of the future.ğŸ”¹ People at the Center of EverythingOne of the most powerful moments was a talk by Golan Vach, who said: â¡ â€œWhat makes the difference is the extra mile.â€ â¡ â€œPeople are always the difference.â€ These words captured a key insight from this journey: innovation only becomes real when driven by passionate, purpose-driven people.ğŸ”¹ Culture That InspiresExperiencing the Shabbat, walking the Via Dolorosa, visiting the Church of the Holy Sepulchre, feeling the energy of the Western Wall, sleeping in the desert, being welcomed into a Bedouin tent, and visiting Yad Vashem â€” I came to understand that the strength of a culture lies in its people.ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡ª Dubai: Where Tradition Meets Bold Vision ğŸ”¹ Living Culture on Every CornerBy walking the streets, listening to locals, and exploring markets and mosques, I gained a meaningful glimpse into a rich and inspiring culture.ğŸ”¹ A Window into the FutureThe Museum of the Future in Dubai was a standout moment â€” a bold vision of the world in 2071.â€‹What struck me most was how Dubai and Israel, though different in approach, are aligned on global key challengers â€” such as shifting to plant-based food and improving waste management.Both the Museum of the Future and the Peres Center for Peace and Innovation inspire us to shape a better world by combining vision with real solutions. Different approaches, yet deeply complementary â€” a clear sign that some challenges can only be solved through global collaboration.-----This incredible journey was just the beginning. In 2024, I started an MBA in AI & Big Data at USP to deepen my purpose-driven path.
